entry.title: Re: Upload of supplement and transfer budget in Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello @Keratiya_D 

You are welcome,

To upload Excel data into the system, please follow below

  • OData APIs like API_SALES_ORDER_SRV are available in SAP S/4HANA Public cloud and support data upload via JSON/XML, not Excel directly.
  • To use Excel, you must convert the file to JSON/XML and send it via POST.
  • For business users, standard Fiori apps,like Upload General Journal Entries for General Ledger Accountant -App ID F2548  or Custom Business Objects/App ID-F1712  are better for direct Excel uploads.
  • SAP doesn‚Äôt support classic file-based BAPI uploads in Public Cloud.

You can also refer to below SAP Documentation
SAP S/4HANA Cloud Extensibility Help

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Unable to Clear Special G/L Transactions with CME Ind...
entry.content:
Hello @Blas4 @

Good question! Special G/L indicator S is typically used for down payment requests, while A is used for actual down payments.

Please check the configuration in SSCUI 101044 ‚Äì Configure Payment Methods for Country/Company Code, and make sure:

  • The payment method allows Special G/L transactions.
  • The indicator S is supported for your posting scenario.

In SAP S/4HANA Public cloud, the use of special G/L indicators is predefined, so if you're posting an actual down payment, you should use A instead of S.

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Price change of Material by Fiori app Manage Material...
entry.content:
Hello @ai_takahashi 

Since release 2105, the price change carried over to current period behaviour is standard and non-configurable in SAP S4 Public cloud. This means that any price change posted in a closed period is automatically applied in the current period and cannot be reversed, including via FB08.

This behaviour supports period consistency and aligns with the cloud fit-to-standard approach.

For IFRS compliance where reversals may be required you‚Äôll need to handle such adjustments via parallel ledgers (e.g., 0L for IFRS) or manual postings, rather than reversing the material valuation itself.

Manage Material Valuations-App ID: F2680

Best regards,

Chuma

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Automation project cannot run with desktop agent
entry.content: If your process that initiates a bot automation does not run and it is hanging state, it is because the desktop agent version installed locally should be greater than or equal to the minimum desktop agent version maintained in the project settings. For more info refer to Step 4 of this tutorial https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/spa-run-process-automation-decision.html . Also go through this setup just in case to make sure things are setup correctly. https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/spa-run-agent-settings..html

entry.title: Unlocking Multilingual Document Translation with SAP Build Apps + SAP BTP Translation Hub
entry.content:
In our previous blog post, we explored how to enable text translation within SAP Build Apps using SAP Translation Hub, making apps more inclusive and globally accessible.

Now, let‚Äôs take this a step further. What if you need to translate entire documents‚Äîlike Word files, PDFs, or HTML content? In this post, we‚Äôll demonstrate how to integrate SAP Build Apps with SAP Translation Hub to create a document translation flow‚Äîquickly, efficiently, and without writing extensive code.

üìñStory: One Quote, Two Languages ‚Äî One Lost Deal?

Meet Alex, a sales manager at a global electronics company based in Germany. He‚Äôs chasing a big opportunity with a Japanese client. The quote is ready, the price is right ‚Äî but it‚Äôs in English. The client requests it in Japanese.

Alex scrambles. He asks a colleague for help. He copy-pastes parts of the quote into a translation tool. He worries about accuracy, especially with technical terms. Meanwhile, the competitor ‚Äî who sent a native-language quote ‚Äî wins the deal

Could this have been avoided? Absolutely.

Enter SAP Build Apps + SAP Translation Hub ‚Äî a powerful no-code solution to translate sales quotes and documents instantly, either as a standalone tool or tightly integrated with SAP CX Sales Cloud.

üß∞ Prerequisites

To implement this solution, you‚Äôll need:

  • ‚úÖSAP BTP subaccount with access to:
    • SAP Build Apps
    • SAP Translation Hub (entitlement required)
  • ‚úÖSAP CX Sales Cloud (optional, for embedded use case)
  • ‚úÖDocument format: PDF, DOCX, or HTML
  • ‚úÖBTP Destination or integration layer (CAP / SAP Integration Suite)

üéØUse Case: Quote Translation in SAP Sales Cloud

Sales teams often generate quotes in their default language. However, sending proposals in a customer‚Äôs native language improves clarity, trust, and conversion rates.

Example:
A salesperson in Spain generates a quote in English and wants to send it to a client in Brazil. Using this solution, the salesperson uploads the quote, selects ‚ÄúPortuguese (Brazil)‚Äù as the target language, and receives a translated document ‚Äî within seconds.

The translated document is then sent directly to the customer or attached to the Sales Cloud opportunity.

üõ†Ô∏è How It Works

  1. Generate Quote (SAP CX Sales Cloud): Standard PDF/Word output from a quote process.
  2. Upload to SAP Build Apps: User uploads the file and selects target language.
  3. Translation via SAP Translation Hub: The file is translated via secure API calls.
  4. Return Translated File: File is returned as downloadable content or pushed back to SAP Sales Cloud in attachment Tab.

üîÑ Deployment Options: Standalone or Integrated

Option 1: Standalone App (No SAP CX Required)

  • A universal tool for business users across sales, legal, procurement, etc.
  • Upload any business document and get instant translations.
  • Deploy via SAP Build Apps and BTP ‚Äî no coding needed.
  • Useful even for companies not yet using SAP Sales Cloud.

Option 2: Embedded in SAP CX Sales Cloud

  • Add translation buttons directly in the Quote Object Page.
  • Automatically trigger translation after quote generation.
  • Store translated versions in the same quote  record.

üìà Business Benefits

Benefit Standalone App SAP Sales Cloud Integration

BenefitStandalone AppSAP Sales Cloud Integration
üåêGlobal content readiness‚úÖTranslate any document‚úÖTranslate sales-specific content
üïíFast time-to-quote‚úÖInstant translation‚úÖAutomated translation post-quote
üõ†Ô∏è Low-code implementation‚úÖFully no-code UI‚úÖExtendable via BTP/Events
üîêSecure enterprise workflow‚úÖControlled via BTP auth‚úÖAudit-ready and version controlled
üì¶Reusable across teams‚úÖAny department can use‚úÖTight sales workflow integration

SAP Translation Hub - Document Translation - Overview

 

 

 

Benefit Standalone App SAP Sales Cloud Integration

Step By Step

Please create the destination with the necessary values.

Drag and drop the required components onto the user interface.

Fetch and bind available languages directly from the Translation Hub API

Upload the PDF file in English format from the local file system

After selecting the target language, click the "Translate" button to proceed.

Video

Until now, we explored the process as a standalone document. Now, let‚Äôs look at how this can be embedded within the CX Sales Cloud V2 Quote :

  • üíºSeamless Integration with CX Sales Cloud V2 Quote
    Embed the translation workflow directly into the quoting process.
  • üìÑSales Representative Uploads the Quote PDF
    The sales rep can upload a quote document in their native language.
  • üåêAutomatic Translation to Desired Language
    The uploaded PDF is translated into the target language using SAP Translation Hub.
  • üìéTranslated Document Attached Automatically
    The translated PDF is added to the Attachments tab of the quote.
  • ‚úâÔ∏èSend via DocuSign for Digital Signature
    The finalized, translated quote is sent to the customer through DocuSign for e-signature.

Embed the above standardized document into the Sales Cloud V2 Quote document.

The document was originally shared via a standard email. This same method can also be utilized to initiate a DocuSign signature request

Architecture

SAP Sales Cloud 
                     ‚Üì
SAP Build Apps UI (File Upload + Language )
                     ‚Üì
BTP Integration (Destination)
                    ‚Üì
SAP Translation Hub API (Document Translation)
                    ‚Üì
Translated Quote Returned to Build App ‚Üí Uploaded back to Sales Cloud or emailed

üìùConclusion

Translating sales quotes and documents no longer needs to be a manual, error-prone, or time-consuming task. With the powerful combination of SAP Build Apps and SAP Translation Hub, businesses can easily deliver personalized, localized content‚Äîwhether in a standalone translation portal or as an embedded feature within SAP Sales Cloud.

This solution empowers sales teams to communicate more effectively, close deals faster, and build stronger relationships with global customers‚Äîall without writing a single line of code on the frontend.

As businesses continue to expand across borders, language accessibility becomes a strategic advantage. By embracing low-code translation automation, you're not just simplifying operations ‚Äî you're enhancing the customer experience where it counts the most.

entry.title: Overview of a Reference ESG IT Architecture using SAP Sustainability Control Tower as central app
entry.content:
Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) is a framework for assessing an organization‚Äôs practices and performance on sustainability and ethical issues. An effective ESG IT architecture supports rapid growth, adapts to evolving requirements, enables flexible reporting, ensures robust data security, and fosters stakeholder trust through transparent and accountable practices.

 

"You can have data without information, but you cannot have information without data," by Daniel Keys Moran, is highly relevant to ESG data management.
 
Good decisions are the foundation for embracing ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) changes. These decisions rely on data, which is why there's a growing demand for ESG-related information. A company's IT system supports smart and fast decisions by providing clear insights on emissions, natural resources, and employees across the entire business. This leads to better investments, lower risks, an improved supply chain, stronger resilience, and attracts new customers, lenders, and investors.
 
A solid IT strategy is super important for hitting ESG targets. Many companies have some idea of their ESG impact, but a focused ESG IT setup can make it easier to measure, track, and improve their impact. This can uncover ways to cut waste, reduce carbon emissions, protect nature, and boost social good. It‚Äôs critical for reaching bigger ESG goals.
 
A well-designed and properly implemented IT system or IT architecture is essential for successfully guiding an organization‚Äôs ESG strategy and integrating it into business processes. The IT architecture I‚Äôm referring to is a comprehensive, organization-wide system that spans all business areas and is guided by the organization‚Äôs ESG strategy or we can call it as a ESG IT Architecture. 

The ESG IT architecture is divided into four vertical layers, each representing a distinct function in the data lifecycle: Data Generation & Collection, Data Harmonization, Contextualization, and Staging, Data Analysis, and Steering and Reporting. These layers are supported by Data Governance, such as Master Data Management, Data Security and Privacy which ensure consistency, security, and governance across the ESG data lifecycle.

 
1. Data Generation and Collection
The Data Generation & Collection layer serves as the foundational step in the ESG data pipeline, where raw data related to environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors is generated or sourced from diverse internal and external systems. This layer encompasses several key components: ESG-specific systems that capture data on emissions, environmental, health, and safety (EHS) metrics, sustainability indicators, and external ESG ratings; business transaction systems such as ERP, SCM, and HRMS, which provide critical business context like travel, procurement, and logistics data relevant to ESG impact; and other sources, including utility consumption records, IoT devices, facility management systems, and satellite or geospatial data. This layer feeds raw, often unstructured or semi-structured data into the Data Integration layer, where it must be normalized across various formats and systems to enable effective analysis.
 
2. Data Integration
The Data Integration layer transforms diverse raw data into a harmonized, contextualized, and structured format suitable for analysis. Its key components include an Enterprise Data Hub, which serves as a central platform for collecting data from all sources, and a Central ESG Data Hub, a specialized repository designed for ESG analytics and reporting. Processes such as data harmonization (standardizing formats), contextualization (adding meaning or context), and staging (temporary storage before use) are critical. This layer acts as a bridge, receiving data from the Data Generation & Collection layer and sending clean, consistent data to the Data Analysis layer for further processing.
 
3. Dat Analysis
This layer leverages cleaned and structured data to generate actionable ESG insights, perform calculations, and support sustainability goal-setting. Key components include the SAP Sustainability Control Tower, a central analytics platform, alongside ESG dimensions (e.g., emissions, diversity, safety), KPI calculations to track performance, and ESG metrics derived from integrated data. It also facilitates short- and long-term ESG goal planning. The layer ingests harmonized data from the Integration layer, provides analytical outputs to the Steering & Reporting layer, and may feed data back into operational systems to enhance processes.
 
4. Steering & Reporting
The final layer facilitates decision-making, internal governance, and external ESG disclosures by leveraging insights from the Data Analysis layer. Its key components include ESG reporting for regulatory (mandatory), voluntary, and internal purposes; management of ESG programs like decarbonization or circular economy initiatives; and advanced analytics, such as predictive modeling, real-time dashboards, and visual storytelling. This layer relies on accurate and timely insights from the Data Analysis layer to enable business units and executives to steer ESG strategy. Reporting outputs may also create a feedback loop, influencing data generation practices to refine the overall process.
 
The ESG IT architecture transforms raw data into actionable insights through a cohesive, interconnected framework. It collects and normalizes diverse data, integrates and harmonizes it for analysis, and generates ESG metrics to support goal-setting. The steering and reporting layer drives decision-making and compliance, enhancing organizational ESG performance.
 
Thank you for taking the time to read my blog. I truly appreciate your interest with this critical topic. If you have any thoughts, questions, or ideas to share, please feel free to leave a comment.
 
Sreekanth

entry.title: Excel Upload/Download for Custom Tables ‚Äì With Check Table Validation
entry.content:
Hi Community,
In this blog, we‚Äôll explore how to build a custom ABAP utility that enables Excel-based upload and download functionality for Z-tables, with real-time validation against check table entries. This solution allows users to generate Excel templates, validate input data during upload, and update custom tables dynamically all from a single report.

Introduction

In many SAP projects, business users request Excel-based upload and download features for ease of data entry and mass maintenance. However, ensuring data integrity during uploads‚Äîespecially for custom tables with check table dependencies‚Äîis crucial.
This blog showcases a utility report in ABAP that enables:

  • Downloading a Z-table structure into Excel from Se16N

  • Uploading Excel data back into SAP

  • Validating data against defined check tables

  • Updating the custom table only if validation passes

Let‚Äôs walk through the solution with modular includes, class-based design, and user-friendly error handling via SALV.

Solution Overview

The solution is built using:

  • Modular Includes: Top declarations, selection screens, class definitions, and implementations are separated for clarity.

  • Dynamic Programming: Internal tables and field symbols are generated at runtime based on the table name.

  • SOI Interface: SAP Office Integration is used to parse Excel.

  • Check Table Validation: All dependent fields are validated using metadata (from DDIF_FIELDINFO_GET).

  • Error Handling: Errors are displayed using SALV with row indicators.

Selection Screen Design

Two main modes:

  • Export: Generates an Excel template based on a selected custom table and navigates to SE16N.

  • Import: Reads and uploads validated Excel content into the corresponding Z-table.

 

Below is the Report Program zcustom_excel

REPORT zcustom_excel.
INCLUDE zcust_excel_top.
INCLUDE zcust_excel_sel.
INCLUDE zcust_excel_cls_dfn.
INCLUDE zcust_excel_cls_dec.
INITIALIZATION.
  CLEAR: go_ref.
  go_ref = NEW lcl_header_values( ).
  go_ref->initialize( ).
AT SELECTION-SCREEN OUTPUT.
  LOOP AT SCREEN INTO DATA(ls_screen).
    IF ls_screen-name CS 'PATH'.
      ls_screen-active = COND #( WHEN rb_exp = abap_true THEN 0 ELSE 1 ).
      MODIFY SCREEN FROM ls_screen.
    ENDIF.
  ENDLOOP.
AT SELECTION-SCREEN.
  go_ref->file_import( ).
AT SELECTION-SCREEN ON VALUE-REQUEST FOR p_path.
  go_ref->pop_up_dialogue( ).
START-OF-SELECTION.
  go_ref->operation( ).
‚Äã

Top Declaration is done in INCLUDE zcust_excel_top. 

TYPES:BEGIN OF gty_msg, 
         lights(4) TYPE c, 
         row       TYPE i, 
         message   TYPE tdline, 
       END OF gty_msg. 
 DATA:gs_msg          TYPE gty_msg, 
      gt_msg          TYPE TABLE OF gty_msg, 
      gv_wtitle       TYPE string , 
      gv_format       TYPE string, 
      gt_dyn_tab      TYPE REF TO data, 
      gt_dyn_tab1     TYPE REF TO data, 
      go_salv         TYPE REF TO cl_salv_table, 
 ##NEEDED      gv_msg          TYPE REF TO cx_salv_msg, 
      gt_table_filds  TYPE TABLE OF dfies, 
      gt_table_filds1 TYPE TABLE OF dfies, 
      gs_dyn_tab      TYPE REF TO data, 
      gv_auth_result  TYPE c LENGTH 1. 
 FIELD-SYMBOLS:<fs_val>       TYPE any, 
               <fs_dyn>       TYPE STANDARD TABLE, 
               <fs_dyn1>      TYPE STANDARD TABLE, 
               <fs_dyns>      TYPE any, 
               <fs_dyn_field> TYPE any.



Parameter declaration is done in include ZCUST_EXCEL_SEL 

PARAMETERS:p_tab TYPE zch_de_tabname OBLIGATORY. 
 SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK b1 WITH FRAME TITLE TEXT-006. 
   PARAMETERS:rb_exp RADIOBUTTON GROUP grp MODIF ID rb1 DEFAULT 'X' USER-COMMAND rb, 
              rb_imp RADIOBUTTON GROUP grp  MODIF ID rb2. 
  
SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK b1. 
 SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK b3 WITH FRAME TITLE TEXT-007. 
   PARAMETERS: p_path TYPE ibipparms-path MODIF ID fil. 
 SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK b3. ‚Äã

Class Definition is done in the include INCLUDE zcust_excel_cls_dfn. 

CLASS  lcl_header_values DEFINITION. 
   PUBLIC SECTION. 
     METHODS: file_import, 
       operation, 
       pop_up_dialogue, 
       initialize. 
  
ENDCLASS. 
 DATA go_ref TYPE REF TO  lcl_header_values.

Class Implementation is done in include INCLUDE zcust_excel_cls_dec 

 CLASS lcl_header_values IMPLEMENTATION.
 
"File_import method is used to do the validation based on Input table name in "selection screen.  
METHOD file_import.
 
    SELECT low FROM tvarvc WHERE name = 'ZCUST_TAB_TVARVC' AND low = @p_tab INTO TABLE (lt_tvarvc).
 
    CASE sy-ucomm.
 
      WHEN  'ONLI'.
 
        IF p_tab+0(1) <> 'Z'.
 
          MESSAGE 'Given table is not a custom table' TYPE 'E'.
 
        ELSEIF p_tab IS NOT INITIAL.
 
          SELECT tabname  FROM dd02l WHERE tabname LIKE 'Z%' AND tabclass = 'TRANSP'  AND    ##NEEDED
 
          tabname = @p_tab INTO TABLE (lt_tabname).
 
          IF sy-subrc NE 0.
 
            MESSAGE 'Given table is not existing in the system' TYPE 'E' .
 
          ENDIF.
 
        ENDIF.
 

    
 
        IF p_path IS INITIAL AND rb_imp EQ abap_true.
 
          MESSAGE 'table name Filed can''t be empty' TYPE 'E'.
 
        ENDIF.
 
    ENDCASE.
 

  ENDMETHOD.
 
  METHOD operation.
 
    DATA:lt_excel    TYPE TABLE OF alsmex_tabline,
 
         lv_col      TYPE i,
 
         lv_flag     TYPE abap_bool,
 
         lo_cols     TYPE REF TO cl_salv_columns_table,
 
         lo_column   TYPE REF TO cl_salv_column,
 
         lv_table    TYPE char50,
 
         lv_field    TYPE char50,
 
         lv_clause   TYPE char200,
 
         lt_tab      TYPE string_table,
 
       ##NEEDED ls_tab      LIKE LINE OF lt_tab,
 
         lv_transaction TYPE tstc-tcode VALUE 'SE16N',
 
         lv_count    TYPE i VALUE 0.
TYPES: BEGIN OF hex_record,
 
                 myhex TYPE x LENGTH 1024,
 
               END OF hex_record.
 
        DATA lt_upload     TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF hex_record.
 
        DATA lv_filelength TYPE i.
 
        DATA:gv_filename TYPE string.

 
"Based on custom table name it will navigate to se16n screen 
    IF rb_exp EQ abap_true.
 
      SET PARAMETER ID 'DTB' FIELD p_tab.
"Providing Authorization 
      AUTHORITY-CHECK OBJECT 'S_TCODE'
 
               ID 'TCD' FIELD 'SE16N'.
 
      IF sy-subrc EQ 0.
 
        CALL TRANSACTION  lv_transaction.
 
      ELSE.
 
        MESSAGE 'User dont have authorization for SE16N T-Code' TYPE 'E'.
 
      ENDIF.
 
    ELSEIF rb_imp EQ abap_true.
 "Here we are mainataining some custom table that supposed to insert the data 
      SELECT low FROM tvarvc WHERE name = 'ZCUST_TAB_TVARVC' AND low = @p_tab INTO TABLE (lt_tvarvc).
 
      IF lt_tvarvc IS NOT INITIAL.
 
"Here we are Creating the dynamic internal table based on the table we have "provided in the selection screen
        CREATE DATA gt_dyn_tab TYPE  TABLE OF (p_tab).
 
        CREATE DATA gs_dyn_tab TYPE (p_tab).
 
        CREATE DATA gt_dyn_tab1 TYPE  TABLE OF (p_tab).
 
        ASSIGN gt_dyn_tab->* TO <fs_dyn>.
 
        ASSIGN gt_dyn_tab1->* TO <fs_dyn1>.
 
        ASSIGN gs_dyn_tab->* TO <fs_dyns>.
 
        
 
        gv_filename = p_path.
 


        cl_sovy_container_control=>get_container_control(
 
          EXPORTING
 
            office_integration_mode = cl_sovy_container_control=>soi_mode_import
 
*           config                  = VALUE #( enforce_new_integration = enforce )
 
          IMPORTING
 
            control                 = DATA(control) ).
 
        DATA(container) = NEW cl_gui_custom_container( container_name = 'CONTAINER' ).
 
        control->init_control( r3_application_name = 'SHEET_IMPORT'
 
                               parent              = container ).
 
        control->get_document_proxy( EXPORTING document_type  = 'Excel.Sheet'
 
                                     IMPORTING document_proxy = DATA(document_proxy) ).
 
        CALL FUNCTION 'GUI_UPLOAD'
           EXPORTING
             filename   = gv_filename
             filetype   = 'BIN'
           IMPORTING
             filelength = lv_filelength
           TABLES
             data_tab   = lt_upload.
 

        document_proxy->open_document_from_table( document_size  = lv_filelength
 
                                                 document_table = lt_upload ).
 
        document_proxy->get_spreadsheet_interface( IMPORTING sheet_interface = DATA(sheet) ).
 
        DATA sheetname TYPE soi_field_name.
 
        sheetname = 'Sheet1'.
 
        sheet->get_active_sheet( IMPORTING sheetname = sheetname ).
 
        DATA(rangesdef) = VALUE soi_dimension_table( ( row     = 1
 
                                                    column  = 1
 
                                                    rows    = 1000
 
                                                    columns = 20 ) ).
 
        DATA ranges   TYPE soi_range_list.
 
        DATA : contents TYPE soi_generic_table,
 
               ls_data  TYPE soi_generic_item.
 
        sheet->get_ranges_data( EXPORTING rangesdef = rangesdef
 
                                IMPORTING contents  = contents
 
                                CHANGING  ranges    = ranges ).
 
        IF sy-subrc EQ 0.
 
*** --- Sort
 
          SORT lt_excel BY row.
 

*          LOOP AT lt_excel INTO DATA(ls_excel).
 
          LOOP AT contents INTO ls_data.
 
*** --- Adding count to skip the mapping for MANDT field
 
*            lv_col = ls_excel-col + 1.
 
            lv_col = ls_data-column + 1.
 

            ASSIGN COMPONENT lv_col OF STRUCTURE <fs_dyns> TO <fs_dyn_field>.
 
            IF sy-subrc = 0.
 
***-- Compare Excel sheet column data and Dynamic table fields
 
*              IF ls_excel-row = 1.
 
              IF ls_data-row = 1.
 
                CALL FUNCTION 'DDIF_FIELDINFO_GET'      "#EC CI_SUBRC
                   EXPORTING
                     tabname        = p_tab
                   TABLES
                     dfies_tab      = gt_table_filds
                   EXCEPTIONS ##FM_SUBRC_OK
                     not_found      = 1
                     internal_error = 2
                     OTHERS         = 3.
 
                IF sy-subrc IS NOT INITIAL.
 
                  MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno
 
                          WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4.
 
                ENDIF.
 
                READ TABLE gt_table_filds INTO DATA(ls_table_fields) INDEX lv_col.
 
                IF sy-subrc = 0.
 

                  IF ls_table_fields-scrtext_m EQ ls_data-value OR ls_table_fields-scrtext_l EQ ls_data-value  .
 
                  ELSE.
 
                    MESSAGE 'Provided table is not matching with the Excel data ' TYPE 'E'.
 
                    LEAVE SCREEN.
 
                  ENDIF.
 
                ENDIF.
 
              ELSE.
 
*                <fs_dyn_field> = ls_excel-value.
                 <fs_dyn_field> = ls_data-value.
 
              ENDIF.
 
            ENDIF.
 
*            IF ls_excel-row GT 1.
 
            DATA(lv_val) = ls_data-value.
 
            IF ls_data-row GT 1.
 
              AT NEW row.
 
                IF lv_val IS INITIAL .
 
                  EXIT.
 
                ENDIF.
 
              ENDAT .
 
              AT END OF row.
 
                IF <fs_dyns>  IS ASSIGNED AND  <fs_dyn> IS ASSIGNED.
 
                  APPEND <fs_dyns> TO <fs_dyn>.
 
                ENDIF.
 
                CLEAR <fs_dyns>.
 
              ENDAT.
 
            ENDIF.
 
*            NEW
 
*            ENDIF.
 
*            end
 
          ENDLOOP.
 
        ENDIF.
 


        "Excel data to validate
 
        LOOP AT <fs_dyn> ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<lfs_dn1>).
 
          lv_count =  lv_count + 1.
 
          CLEAR:lv_flag.
 
          "Checking for any custom table is linked with Check table
 
          LOOP AT gt_table_filds ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<lfs_tab>) WHERE checktable IS NOT INITIAL. "#EC CI_NESTED
 
            "To fetch the Check table information
 
            ASSIGN COMPONENT <lfs_tab>-fieldname OF STRUCTURE <lfs_dn1> TO  <fs_val>.
 
            IF <fs_val> IS ASSIGNED AND <fs_val> IS NOT INITIAL.
 
              IF <lfs_tab>-fieldname EQ 'MATNR'.
 
                CALL FUNCTION 'CONVERSION_EXIT_MATN1_INPUT'     "#EC CI_SUBRC
                   EXPORTING
                     input        = <fs_val>
                   IMPORTING
                     output       = <fs_val>
                   EXCEPTIONS
                     length_error = 1
                     OTHERS       = 2.
 
                IF sy-subrc <> 0.
 
                  MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno
 
                          WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4.
 
                ENDIF.
 
              ELSE.
                 <fs_val> = |{ <fs_val> ALPHA = IN }|.
 
              ENDIF.
 
              CALL FUNCTION 'DDIF_FIELDINFO_GET'  "#EC CI_SUBRC
                 EXPORTING
                   tabname        = <lfs_tab>-checktable
                 TABLES
                   dfies_tab      = gt_table_filds1
                 EXCEPTIONS
                   not_found      = 1
                   internal_error = 2
                   OTHERS         = 3.
 
              IF sy-subrc IS NOT INITIAL.
 
                MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno
 
                        WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4.
 
              ENDIF.
 
              READ TABLE gt_table_filds1  INTO DATA(ls_fields1) WITH KEY domname = <lfs_tab>-domname."Reading the Check table field
 
              IF sy-subrc EQ 0.
 
                lv_field = ls_fields1-fieldname.   "check table field
 
                lv_table = <lfs_tab>-checktable.  "check table name
 
                "Comparing each Excel data with the check table value if it is exist or not
 
                lv_clause = |{ lv_field }| && | = | && |'| && |{ <fs_val> }| && |'| .
 
                SELECT SINGLE (lv_field)  FROM (lv_table) INTO ls_tab WHERE (lv_clause). "#EC CI_SUBRC
 
                CLEAR :ls_tab.
 
                IF sy-subrc NE 0.
 
                  gs_msg-message = TEXT-010. "text-010(Data has not updated)
 
                  gs_msg-row = lv_count.
 
                  gs_msg-lights = 1.
 
                  APPEND gs_msg TO gt_msg.
 
                  CLEAR:gs_msg.
 
                  lv_flag = abap_true.
 
                ENDIF.
 
              ENDIF.
 
            ENDIF.
 
          ENDLOOP.
 
*        IF sy-subrc NE 0.
 
          IF lv_flag EQ abap_false.
 
            gs_msg-message = TEXT-011 .
 
            gs_msg-row = lv_count.
 
            gs_msg-lights = 3.
 
            APPEND gs_msg TO gt_msg.
 
            CLEAR:gs_msg.
 
            APPEND <lfs_dn1> TO <fs_dyn1>.
 
            CLEAR: <lfs_dn1>.
 
          ENDIF.
 
        ENDLOOP.
//Locking the table.
        IF <fs_dyn1> IS ASSIGNED AND <fs_dyn1> IS NOT INITIAL.
 
          CALL FUNCTION 'ENQUEUE_E_TABLE'
             EXPORTING
               mode_rstable   = 'E'
               tabname        = p_tab
             EXCEPTIONS
               foreign_lock   = 1
               system_failure = 2
               OTHERS         = 3.
 
          IF sy-subrc EQ 0.
 
            MODIFY (p_tab) FROM TABLE <fs_dyn1>.
 
            IF sy-subrc EQ 0.
 
              COMMIT WORK.
 
            ELSE.
 
              ROLLBACK WORK.
 
            ENDIF.
 
            CALL FUNCTION 'DEQUEUE_E_TABLE'
               EXPORTING
                 mode_rstable = 'E'
                 tabname      = p_tab.
 
          ENDIF.
 
                                                          "#EC CI_SUBRC
 
        ENDIF.
 
*Data is updated succussfully without any interruption then display's below message
 
        IF gt_msg IS INITIAL.
 
          MESSAGE TEXT-008 TYPE 'S'.  "text-008(Data is Updated succussfully)
 
        ENDIF.
 
        IF gt_msg IS NOT INITIAL.
 
          TRY.
 
              cl_salv_table=>factory(
 
                IMPORTING
 
                  r_salv_table = go_salv                       " Basis Class Simple ALV Tables
 
                CHANGING
 
                  t_table      = gt_msg
 
              ).
 
            ##NO_HANDLER            CATCH cx_salv_msg INTO gv_msg.
 
          ENDTRY.
 
          TRY.
 
              lo_cols = go_salv->get_columns( ).
 
              lo_cols->set_exception_column(
 
                value = 'LIGHTS' ).
 
            ##NO_HANDLER  CATCH cx_salv_data_error.
 
          ENDTRY.
 
          TRY.
 
              lo_column = lo_cols->get_column( columnname = 'ROW' ).
 
              lo_column->set_long_text( ‚ÄòRow' ).
 
              lo_column->set_medium_text( 'Row‚Äô ).
 
              lo_column->set_short_text( ‚ÄòRow‚Äô ).
 
              lo_column->set_output_length( 6 ).
 

              lo_column = lo_cols->get_column( columnname = 'MESSAGE' ).
 
              lo_column->set_long_text( ‚ÄòMessage‚Äô ).
 
              lo_column->set_medium_text( ‚ÄòMessage‚Äô ).
 
              lo_column->set_short_text( ‚ÄòMessage' ).
 
              lo_column->set_output_length( 15 ).
 
            ##NO_HANDLER           CATCH cx_salv_not_found.
 
          ENDTRY.
 

**Displaying the Error mesage in ouput
 
          go_salv->display( ).
 
          CLEAR:gt_msg.
 
        ENDIF.
 
      ELSE.
 
        MESSAGE e242(zotc_r1_message) WITH p_tab.
 
      ENDIF.
 
    ENDIF.
 

  ENDMETHOD.
 
  METHOD pop_up_dialogue.
 
    DATA:lv_rc   TYPE i,
 
         lt_file TYPE TABLE OF file_table.
 
    TRY.
 
        gv_wtitle = ‚ÄòPlease Select the file'.
 
        cl_gui_frontend_services=>file_open_dialog(       "#EC CI_SUBRC
 
          EXPORTING
 
            window_title            = gv_wtitle                 " Title Of File Open Dialog
 
            default_filename        = gv_format                 " Default File Name
 
            file_filter             = cl_gui_frontend_services=>filetype_excel                 " File Extension Filter String
 
          CHANGING
 
            file_table              = lt_file                 " Table Holding Selected Files
 
            rc                      = lv_rc              " Return Code, Number of Files or -1 If Error Occurred
 
          EXCEPTIONS
 
            file_open_dialog_failed = 1                " "Open File" dialog failed
 
            cntl_error              = 2                " Control error
 
            error_no_gui            = 3                " No GUI available
 
            not_supported_by_gui    = 4                " GUI does not support this
 
            OTHERS                  = 5
 
        ).
 

        IF sy-subrc <> 0.
 
          CASE sy-subrc.
 
            WHEN 1.
 
              MESSAGE ‚Äòfile_openDialog_failed‚Äô TYPE 'E'.
 
            WHEN 2.
 
              MESSAGE ‚ÄòControl_Error' TYPE 'E'.
 
            WHEN 3.
 
              MESSAGE ‚ÄòError_no_gui‚Äô TYPE 'E'.
 
            WHEN 4.
 
              MESSAGE ‚ÄòNot supported by GUI‚Äô TYPE 'E'.
 
            WHEN OTHERS.
 
              MESSAGE ‚ÄòOther issue‚Äô TYPE 'E'.
 
          ENDCASE.
 
        ENDIF.
 
      CATCH cx_root INTO DATA(lx_error).
 
        MESSAGE lx_error->get_text( ) TYPE 'E'.
 
    ENDTRY.
 


    IF lt_file IS NOT INITIAL.
 
      p_path = lt_file[ 1 ]-filename.
 
    ENDIF.
 
  ENDMETHOD.
 
  METHOD initialize.
 
    CLEAR: gs_msg, gt_msg, gv_wtitle       ,
 
     gv_format       ,
 
     gt_dyn_tab      ,
 
     gt_dyn_tab1     ,
 
     go_salv         ,
 
     gv_msg          ,
 
     gt_table_filds  ,
 
     gt_table_filds1 ,
 
     gs_dyn_tab    ,
 
     gv_auth_result.
 
  ENDMETHOD.
 
ENDCLASS.

So ,The output Screen will be as below 
Screenshots / Walkthrough

Export Mode (SE16N)

‚úÖ Enter a valid custom table name
‚úÖ Select Export ‚Üí Runs SE16N for the table




Download the Table Data

Download data as Excel from SE16N and fill in the template

Import Mode

‚úÖ Select Import, provide the Excel path
‚úÖ The report validates each entry and updates records

Example:

  • Mismatch in fields shows error in SALV

  • Valid data gets inserted, shown in success message table




If there is mismatch between the table fields and excel fields we will get some validation error or else the data will be inserted & the output will be showed as below.


 

Important Notes

  • This report is built to work only with custom transparent tables (Z-tables)

  • Validation is driven by check tables defined in the Data Dictionary

  • DDIF_FIELDINFO_GET is used to fetch metadata dynamically

Conclusion

This utility provides a robust, flexible, and reusable solution for Excel-based data uploads and downloads involving custom Z-tables. By validating data against check tables and dynamically creating data structures, the tool ensures that only clean, consistent data is written to the database.

Such a tool not only simplifies end-user data entry but also reduces manual effort and errors significantly.

entry.title: How to subscribe or fetch data from solace to CPI using AEM Adapter : part-5
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community!!!

In the solace subscriber layer(fetching data from solace) solace is a powerful Event Broker which its mainly focus on Guaranteed message delivery and while fetching data from solace if the iflow ran into error the solace would retry sending messages even without checking weather its Recoverable or Non-recoverable errors .if its recoverable error the solace retry would meaningful and if it is the non-recoverable errors the doesn't goes to target if solace retry any number of times.

Implementation :
Layer 1 ‚Äì Solace AEM Sender Adapter subscribes to incoming messages. If an error occurs, it triggers Exception Subprocess for centralized handling, If Error doesn't occur then then the data successfully goes to sftp server. 

Layer 2 ‚Äì Introduced a Groovy-based classification to detect recoverable vs. non-recoverable errors:
Recoverable: Routed to a successful end (ensuring retry by Solace).


Non-recoverable: Sends a custom property (false) back to Solace to prevent retries and routes to escalation.
Escalation Layer ‚Äì Built a downstream flow that integrates with Exception handling layer

This Error handling layer can implemented for notifying the type of error occurred with proper details  
Email for developer alerting
ServiceNow for incident creation
Loggly for traceability

So, this is the implementation of solace subscriber  implementation part and i had given the error handling part in the subscriber part as well so by this the end to end our Event Driven Architecture using solace Event Broker series has came to an End.Stay tuned for Upcoming blogs

entry.title: CREATION OF A BOT 'FILE NAME EXTRACTOR TO EXCEL' USING SAP BTP PROCESS AUTOMATION
entry.content:
The main objective of this Bot is to list and logs files into excel for recordkeeping.

So here are the steps to make this bot automation. 

In SAP Build lobby click on create option. 


After clicking create option, create object interface will open. We have to create automation, for this we have to select Automation Process and click Next.


Now we have to choose type, whether this automation is process type or automation type.

As you can see there are two options, that are, Process and automation.

Process: We have to choose Process when we need to build a business process to automate a workflow. Process is used in automation sales order, invoice management, approval flows.

Automation: We have to choose Automation when we need to automate any repetitive tasks across application. Automation is used in extracting data from documents, mass updates of data, local file management.

So, as per our bot we have to select Automation option.

 

           Name: Name Extractor to Excel
           Description: List and logs files into excel for record keeping purpose.
After filling this click on Review. 


Now click on Create


Now click on Create, then click on Automation.



Then we have to configure agent version.




Name: Name Extractor to Excel. Then click on Create.


Now click on setting icon, then click on Dependencies then add option.


Then click on add and then click on Add a Business Process Project Dependency. then add Excel SDK.


Now we will start building our automation by dragging activities from the pannel to the flow.
The activities we have to use for this automation are
                i) Get File Collection
               ii) Open Excel Instances
              iii) Add Workbook
              iv) Set Values (Cells)
               v) Save as Workbook

In get file collection activity, in folder path give the path of the folder which we have to show.
In set values (Cells) activity we have to define the cell ranges for excel sheet
   Values: Coll
In Save as Workbook activity, in file path give the path with the name of the excel sheet where we have to save the list of files in folder.

Save the flow.


Now test the automation.



Conclusion:
This bot will list out the files of a specified folder in an excel worksheet.  

Best Regards,
Smruti Rekha Pradhan

entry.title: Re: Cannot create Transport request in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello @Keratiya_D 

You're seeing this error because you're trying to create a transport request in a system that‚Äôs not assigned the Export Role (likely a customizing or test tenant). You can solve it, only the Development tenant (DEV) with Export Role can create transport requests. Log in to the DEV system and create the transport there.

Please check with your system administrator or BASIS team which system you're logged into and confirm that you're using the correct Export system (DEV) for customizing transport requests.

3-System Landscape and Transport Management

Transport Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud 3SL (2): Parallel Implementation and Maintenance

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: #SITSP2025 üé§IA Gen AI
entry.content:
Speaker:

üó£Ô∏èJosh Blubeard Bentley 

@josh_bentley 

Josh Bentley is a longtime SAP veteran and current Developer & Community Advocate. With a career that began in the 1990s, Josh has worked in IT, solution engineering, and developer advocacy‚Äîboth at SAP and Red Hat. He is known for his humor, distinctive blue beard, and unwavering commitment to empowering developers and SAP community members worldwide. Today, he helps evangelize SAP‚Äôs developer tools, foster in-person connections, and support initiatives like Devtoberfest and Code Jams across the globe.

 

Talk Description:

Josh‚Äôs session is more than a presentation‚Äîit‚Äôs a story-driven journey through two decades of technological change, community growth, and personal transformation. Touching on everything from the early days of SAP mobility to modern GenAI use cases, Josh highlights the evolution of developer advocacy and SAP‚Äôs approach to cloud and community engagement. At the heart of his message: the SAP community must stay human, vibrant, and connected‚Äîespecially as AI transforms how we interact and learn.

*** Link com todas as palestras ***

Blog Summary:

At SAP Inside Track S√£o Paulo 2025, Josh Bentley took the stage not just as a speaker, but as a storyteller. His session wove humor, self-deprecation, and insight into a compelling reflection on the changing landscape of SAP and developer engagement.

He began with the origin of his infamous blue beard‚Äîa personal branding decision prompted by a playful dare in 2018. What started as a joke became a symbol: of approachability, personality, and connection in a sometimes impersonal tech world. It‚Äôs an icebreaker that invites interaction in every city he visits.

Josh recounted his journey from managing BlackBerrys at SAP‚Äôs Newtown Square campus to his early experiences with mobile platforms like the CIASE unwired platform and SAP Cloud Platform (now SAP BTP). He reflected on his time at Red Hat, where he embraced open source, Kubernetes, and meritocracy before being recruited back to SAP to help explain cloud to sales teams.

The heart of his talk centered around community‚Äîits value, power, and future. He emphasized initiatives like Code Jams, hands-on learning events like the one held the day before at the SAP AppHaus in S√£o Paulo. These sessions, he stressed, aren‚Äôt sales pitches‚Äîthey‚Äôre about real learning, community-building, and access to experts.

Josh also spotlighted DevToberfest, an annual online event that encourages community engagement through live sessions, tutorials, and even prizes. Born during the pandemic, it‚Äôs now a core part of SAP‚Äôs educational ecosystem, and a lead-up to SAP TechEd. He encouraged attendees to watch developer news, join groups, and become event organizers themselves to keep the ecosystem alive and thriving.

On the topic of AI, he offered both enthusiasm and caution. Tools like SAP's GenAI assistant, Juel, offer powerful productivity boosts‚Äîbut also risk hallucinations if not properly guided by real human input. He urged the audience to continue contributing real answers to community.sap.com and emphasized that human interaction must remain central to the SAP learning experience.

Josh closed his talk with gratitude and a call to action. Whether through meetups, blogs, or just joining in conversations, every community member has the power to lead, learn, and grow the SAP ecosystem. And in true Bluebeard fashion, he left behind a few community stickers as a thank-you gesture.

 

Key Takeaways:

  • Community and collaboration are critical to SAP‚Äôs future in a world of AI.

  • Code Jams and DevToberfest are inclusive, hands-on ways to learn and contribute.

  • Human connections matter‚Äîespecially when technology moves fast.

  • Anyone can get involved: organize meetups, share answers, and be visible.

Se voc√™ lida com integra√ß√µes SAP Cloud, vale a pena conferir a apresenta√ß√£o completa e explorar o material adicional fornecido.

entry.title: #SITSP2025DEV üñ•Ô∏è Joule: A nova queridinha da SAP que promete revolucionar a forma que trabalhamos
entry.content:

entry.title: Re: How to subscribe or fetch data from solace to CPI using AEM Adapter : part-5
entry.content:
Hi Pavan

Great article again, as with all your previous ones regarding AEM!

One remark: please note that you need to end processing with an ERROR END event if you want to have retries; otherwise, you will finish with a COMPLETED status.

Another aspect to consider is how to distinguish transient errors from permanent ones. Listing all errors and assigning each to one of these two categories is impossible, given that some HTTP errors cannot be definitively classified as temporary. We can refine the value mapping over time, as it also depends on the target application's behavior. The bottom line I've used for my integrations: it's better to retry data errors than to escalate connectivity ones.

best regards

Mateusz

O SAP Inside Track S√£o Paulo 2025 teve in√≠cio com uma atmosfera acolhedora e bem-humorada, conduzida por Jo√£o Circo, que contextualizou o evento e distribuiu agradecimentos √† comunidade, patrocinadores e √† PUC-SP, anfitri√£ do encontro.

O p√∫blico foi dividido em dois grupos principais: um mais funcional, com gerentes de projeto, PMOs e curiosos sobre o ecossistema SAP, alocado no andar superior; e outro mais t√©cnico, composto por desenvolvedores ABAPs, direcionado ao espa√ßo inferior, carinhosamente apelidado de ‚Äúcalabou√ßo‚Äù. Essa separa√ß√£o permitiu a adequa√ß√£o dos conte√∫dos e experi√™ncias ao perfil dos participantes.

O professor Eduardo Savino, da PUC-SP, apresentou as credenciais da universidade e refor√ßou a import√¢ncia da integra√ß√£o com empresas como a SAP. Destacou a ‚Äútropicaliza√ß√£o‚Äù dos temas abordados no evento, como Pix, Tax Service e reforma tribut√°ria ‚Äì quest√µes diretamente ligadas ao contexto brasileiro e que desafiam a flexibilidade dos sistemas SAP.

Luciano Casado representou a GFX, uma consultoria SAP do Cear√° que completa 15 anos. Com √™nfase em forma√ß√£o e inova√ß√£o, Casado destacou a expertise da empresa em SAP Public Edition, mobilidade e desenvolvimento, al√©m de sua cultura de compromisso com a entrega de projetos e valoriza√ß√£o de talentos locais.

Na sequ√™ncia, Jo√£o Seon apresentou a TakOnix, empresa que fornece solu√ß√µes no-code voltadas √† cria√ß√£o r√°pida de aplicativos Fiori dentro do SAP S/4HANA. A proposta √© eliminar a complexidade de desenvolvimento via ABAP, utilizando uma plataforma que facilita o prot√≥tipo e entrega de valor para o cliente.

Encerrando a abertura, L√≠gera Baceto, da Accenture, descreveu a dimens√£o global da empresa e sua forte atua√ß√£o em projetos SAP. Com mais de 800 mil colaboradores no mundo, a Accenture √© uma das principais parceiras da SAP e refor√ßa seu compromisso de longa data com clientes e inova√ß√£o tecnol√≥gica.

A fala de abertura concluiu com entusiasmo e expectativa para o restante do evento, anunciando a primeira palestra oficial: ‚ÄúBuilding Planning SAP‚Äù com Thiago Pedroso.

entry.title: #SITSP2025 üé§API na pr√°tica para Funcionais

A palestra de K√©ssia Salazar prop√¥s uma abordagem pr√°tica sobre APIs voltada especificamente para consultores funcionais que desejam ou precisam interagir com integra√ß√µes em projetos SAP. O conte√∫do destacou como as APIs s√£o usadas, como podem ser testadas via Postman, os principais conceitos t√©cnicos envolvidos e como fazer uma especifica√ß√£o funcional com conhecimento suficiente para dialogar com desenvolvedores.

*** Link com todas as palestras ***

Resumo do Conte√∫do da Palestra

  • Abertura com reflex√£o sobre diversidade:
    K√©ssia iniciou destacando o aumento da participa√ß√£o feminina no SAP Inside Track e a import√¢ncia de incentivar mulheres na √°rea de tecnologia, especialmente em eventos t√©cnicos como o SIT.

entry.title: #SITSP2025DEV üñ•Ô∏è IA Gen AI
entry.content:
Speaker:
@josh_bentley 
üó£Ô∏èJosh Blubeard Bentley

Josh Bentley is an SAP Developer Advocate and longtime community leader, known for his charismatic presence, approachable personality, and, of course, his bright blue beard. With a background in IT since the 1990s and a tenure at SAP beginning in 2007, Josh has worked through various phases of tech evolution‚Äîfrom managing Blackberries to promoting GenAI, Kubernetes, and containerized cloud applications. His passion lies in empowering others within the SAP community, particularly developers and functional users seeking to collaborate and grow.

Talk Description:
This session was part storytelling, part community call-to-action. Josh shared his personal career path and quirky anecdotes while diving into how SAP‚Äôs mobile, cloud, and community landscapes have changed over time. Though titled around AI, the talk emphasized the enduring value of real-life interaction, collaboration, and community-driven initiatives.

*** Link com todas as palestras ***

Key Takeaways from the Talk:

  • Origin of the Blue Beard:
    Josh opened with the backstory of his iconic beard, initially dyed as a joke to prove he had "personality" on a team. The beard became a conversation starter, a branding tool, and a symbol of his open, engaging approach to tech advocacy.

  • Journey in Tech and SAP:
    Starting in IT during the 1990s, Josh joined SAP in 2007 to manage Blackberries. He witnessed the shift from resisting iPhones to embracing iPads and cloud-first tools. By 2010, SAP was rolling out thousands of iPads, marking a pivotal point in enterprise mobility.

  • Tech Evolution and BTP:
    Josh reflected on SAP‚Äôs transition through platforms like CIASE, CYO, and the evolution to SAP‚Äôs BTP (Business Technology Platform). He noted how SAP acquired niche technologies, integrated them into core offerings, and expanded their use cases globally‚Äîfrom utility pole workers to cross-network SMS translation.

  • Developer Advocacy and Red Hat Influence:
    A stint at Red Hat exposed Josh to open-source values and meritocracy. Upon returning to SAP, he began training sales teams on cloud tech and Kubernetes. His unique background positioned him to bridge the gap between enterprise solutions and hands-on community engagement.

  • Code Jam S√£o Paulo & LATAM Tour:
    The day before the SIT event, Josh hosted a Code Jam with a hands-on GenAI workshop at X Consulting‚Äôs SAP AppHaus. Participants, supported by SAP experts, experimented with SAP‚Äôs GenAI tooling and interfaces like Juel. This Code Jam was part of a larger LATAM tour spanning Lima, Mexico City, Bogot√°, and more.

  • Community and AI Reflections:
    Despite the buzz around AI, Josh cautioned against losing the human element in tech communities. AI tools can hallucinate and mislead, but it‚Äôs the SAP community‚Äîpeople answering questions, organizing meetups, and sharing insights‚Äîthat keeps the ecosystem vibrant and reliable.

  • DevToberfest and TechEd Highlights:
    Josh promoted DevToberfest, a gamified, month-long learning festival leading into SAP TechEd. It includes live sessions, tutorials, and real-time interaction with SAP experts. He also encouraged participation in DemoJam, offering free entry to TechEd Berlin for selected teams.

  • Empowering Local Engagement:
    Josh emphasized that anyone can become a local event organizer, run SITs, or host SAP meetups‚Äîno need to work for SAP. He explained how community members can access support, post events, and receive guidance to grow regional engagement.

  • Closing Thoughts:
    Concluding on a heartfelt note, Josh expressed gratitude for the Brazilian SAP community‚Äôs energy and enthusiasm. He praised the volunteer-led spirit of the S√£o Paulo SIT and reiterated his belief in learning through failure, personal storytelling, and community-building.

Final Note:
Josh Bentley‚Äôs session was a refreshing reminder that amidst fast-evolving tech trends, it‚Äôs the human connections‚Äîmentorships, meetups, and shared learning‚Äîthat sustain innovation. His message was clear: AI might assist, but it‚Äôs people who drive the SAP community forward.

entry.title: #SITSP2025DEV üñ•Ô∏è Como extrair o melhor do SAP com Fiori e personaliza√ß√µes Clean Core
entry.content:
Palestrante

üó£Ô∏èLucas Ferreira

Executivo de contas na Tachyonix, Lucas tem mais de 12 anos de experi√™ncia com SAP, tendo atuado como consultor t√©cnico e funcional, pr√©-vendas e vendedor de solu√ß√µes BTP. Hoje, ele lidera iniciativas que conectam inova√ß√£o com resultados pr√°ticos em projetos SAP.

 

Descri√ß√£o da Palestra

Nesta apresenta√ß√£o, Lucas Ferreira compartilhou como o SAP Fiori evoluiu para ser mais que uma interface amig√°vel ‚Äî ele se tornou a principal porta de entrada para inova√ß√£o e usabilidade no ecossistema SAP. Com bom humor e analogias simples, Lucas abordou como a experi√™ncia do usu√°rio pode ser transformada ao adotar Fiori de maneira estrat√©gica, e como solu√ß√µes de baixo c√≥digo (low-code) integradas ao Clean Core agilizam o desenvolvimento de aplica√ß√µes sem comprometer a governan√ßa do sistema.

*** Link com todas as palestras ***

Conte√∫do do Blog ‚Äì Resumo da Palestra

Lucas iniciou sua palestra destacando um contraste: enquanto muitos usu√°rios ainda utilizam o SAP GUI, o verdadeiro valor do SAP S/4HANA est√° em interfaces modernas e intuitivas como o Fiori. Para demonstrar isso, ele apresentou exemplos visuais e compara√ß√µes com plataformas populares como Netflix e Facebook, que se tornaram refer√™ncias de usabilidade por sua padroniza√ß√£o e simplicidade.

Ele enfatizou que o SAP Fiori:

  • √â intuitivo e padronizado, reduzindo drasticamente o tempo de ado√ß√£o por novos usu√°rios.

  • Permite combinar fun√ß√µes transacionais e anal√≠ticas em uma √∫nica interface.

  • √â hoje o principal canal para entrega de inova√ß√µes da SAP, como o assistente digital Joule.

No entanto, Lucas tamb√©m reconheceu os desafios enfrentados por empresas que precisam de processos customizados, que muitas vezes n√£o s√£o suportados pelos aplicativos Fiori standard. Foi nesse ponto que ele introduziu o conceito de Clean Core, destacando as boas pr√°ticas para desenvolvimento e extensibilidade sem comprometer o n√∫cleo do SAP.

A Tachyonix, empresa onde Lucas atua, oferece uma plataforma que permite a cria√ß√£o de apps Fiori, CDS Views e APIs OData dentro do SAP, com uma abordagem low-code, totalmente aderente ao Clean Core. Essa ferramenta reduz significativamente o tempo e o custo de desenvolvimento de aplica√ß√µes personalizadas.

Exemplos reais foram apresentados, como:

  • Apps desenvolvidos para a Vivo, com entregas 75% mais r√°pidas do que no modelo tradicional.

  • Solu√ß√µes para Suzano, Piracanjuba e Bobst, que integraram Fiori com leitura de QR code, anexos e coleta de dados em mobile.

  • Economia de quase R$ 200 mil em 6 meses pela Piracanjuba usando a plataforma da Tachyonix.

Lucas finalizou a apresenta√ß√£o com uma demonstra√ß√£o pr√°tica do ambiente da Tachyonix dentro do SAP S/4HANA, exibindo a cria√ß√£o de um app de aprova√ß√£o de pedidos de compra. Mostrou tamb√©m dashboards anal√≠ticos criados em poucos cliques, ressaltando a import√¢ncia da converg√™ncia entre dados transacionais e anal√≠ticos na jornada de transforma√ß√£o digital.

entry.title: One-Click Export-Automating SuccessFactors EC New Hire Integration API Document--Optimization
entry.content:
Hello SuccessFolks

In my previous blog posts, I introduced how to utilize a standard and reusable Python script to:

  1. Extract SuccessFactors Employee Central (EC) metadata with attributes
    One-Click Export: Automating SuccessFactors EC API Metadata to Excel
  2. Generate the standard new hire upsert API documentation
    One-Click Export: Automating SuccessFactors EC Standard New Hire Integration

However, I realized these scripts did not fully address certain integration scenarios and code mapping requirements such as Picklists and MDF values. To bridge these gaps, I‚Äôve enhanced the script with a more structured design.

Note: Because I am concerned that sharing the source code in SAP Community have security risk, please @ME in comment if you are interested and I will share it with you in private.

Enhancement Summary

No. Feature Description

1More Integration ScenariosAdded support for: Report No Show, Hire Data Correction, Rehire with Old Employment, Create New Position before upsert new hire
2API OptimizationImproved handling for Dependent Info upsert API.
Added hard-coded Termination eventReason into upsert body.
Removed unnecessary "EndDate" and "background order" fields.
Added isPrimary filters for Email, Phone, and NationalId entities.
3Code-Value Mapping TableAuto-export of picklist values and MDF dropdown values.
4Postman Collection ExportGenerates a ready-to-import Postman collection for testing and validation.
5Script Refactoring & ImprovementsMerged all scripts into one structured file and externalized configuration file for better security.

This enhancement not only improves functionality and coverage but also makes the script easier to maintain, run independently, and adapt to real-world use cases. Feel free to reach out or comment if you have feedback or further enhancement ideas.

README for Script

Below are the README contents generated to help you understand the features and considerations when implementing these enhancements:

Overview

The SuccessFactors EC API Toolkit is a comprehensive Python utility designed to interact with SuccessFactors OData APIs, extract metadata, process API responses, and generate standardized API documentation. This toolkit consolidates multiple specialized scripts into a single, well-structured application that provides end-to-end functionality for API management and documentation generation for Employee Central (EC) data.

Features

  • API Data Retrieval: Connect to SuccessFactors OData APIs and extract entity data
  • Metadata Extraction: Parse XML metadata to understand API structure and field attributes
  • Code-Value Mapping: Extract and process picklist and MDF values and their mappings
  • Data Enrichment: Combine API data with metadata for comprehensive documentation
  • Document Generation: Create standardized API documentation with proper formatting
  • API Testing: Test API endpoints with sample requests and capture responses
  • Template Management: Update API templates with the latest data and formatting
  • Postman Collection: Generate Postman Collection for API testing

Function Descriptions

Utility Functions

  • get_filter: Generates filter strings for API queries
  • clean_metadata_url: Cleans metadata URLs for proper formatting
  • clean_json: Removes specific keys from JSON data and modifies URLs
  • autofit_and_style: Applies formatting to Excel worksheets (column width, headers, borders)
  • capitalize_headers: Capitalizes header row in Excel worksheets
  • reorder_columns: Reorders columns in Excel worksheets based on a specified order
  • get_valid_sheet_name: Generates valid Excel sheet names (31 character limit)
  • transform_json: Transforms JSON data by replacing specific keys with predefined values
  • remove_blank_values: Removes keys with blank values from dictionaries

XML Metadata Parsing Functions

  • get_text: Extracts text from XML elements
  • get_sap_tags: Extracts SAP-specific tags from XML elements
  • get_attr_value: Gets attribute values from XML elements
  • clean_attr: Cleans attribute values for proper formatting

API Data Retrieval Functions

  • get_ec_api_body: Retrieves API data for specified entity sets
  • extract_ec_odata_api_dictionary: Extracts API metadata dictionary
  • get_code_value: Retrieves and processes code-value mappings

Data Merging and Document Generation Functions

  • enrich_upsert_sheet_with_dictionary: Enriches upsert sheet with dictionary data
  • enrich_api_entity_sheet: Enriches API entity sheet with attribute data
  • clean_upsert_and_api_sample: Cleans upsert data and API sample
  • form_standard_api_document: Forms the standard API document
  • post_valid_bodies_and_export_response: Posts valid bodies to API and exports responses
  • update_api_templates: Updates API templates with the latest data

Main Functions

  • merge_ec_api_and_metadata: Combines steps to merge EC API data with metadata
  • form_standard_api_document_full: Combines steps to form the complete standard API document
  • run_full_pipeline: Runs the complete API toolkit pipeline

Output Files

The toolkit generates several Excel and JSON files during processing:

  • 1.SF EC Table API Attribute.xlsx: Contains EC table API attributes
  • 2.SF New Hire Integration Standard API TemplateV1.xlsx: Contains integration templates and master data
  • 3.SF EC Field API Attribute.xlsx: Contains EC field API attributes and metadata
  • 4.SF New Hire Sample API Upsert.xlsx: Contains API sample upsert data
  • 5.SF New Hire API Post Preview.xlsx: Contains API request bodies and responses
  • 6.SF Dropdown CodeValue Table.xlsx: Contains picklist values and their mappings
  • 7.SF Standard New Hire API DocumentV1.xlsx: Contains enriched API documentation
  • 8.SF New Hire Postman_Collection Excel.xlsx: Contains Postman collection data
  • 9.SF New Hire Postman_Collection.json: Contains Postman collection in JSON format

entry.title: RAP : custom entity and data stream
entry.content:
Hello,

I have a very specific need to implement regarding Attachments.
I have implemented a custom entity (exposed with the alias "Attachments") to retrieve attachments from SAP backend to the FIORI Element app.
I have implemented the SELECT method of the RAP query provider (if_rap_query_provider), where i fill the attachment content along with key fields and file properties (mime type/file name).
When I test the GET request to download the file  (.../Attachments(<attachment_key>)/$value)  it returns nothing as content (the request is successful though / status 200)
In Debug mode, I checked that the SELECT method is being called and the content of the RAWSTRING field is filled with the correct data but i get nothing on the frontend side.

I declared the fields in the custom entity like this : 

@Semantics.largeObject : { 
	mimeType : 'MimeType', 
	fileName : 'FileName' } 
AttachmentContent : abap.rawstring(99999); 

@Semantics.mimeType: true 
MimeType : char128; 

FileName : char128;

I have noticed one other thing, not only the content of the response is empty but response headers also are not correct, i dont get what i expect for these two headers :

content-type : "application/octet-stream" instead of the actuel mime type 

content-disposition : "attachment; filename=entity." instead of the actual file name

What did I missed ? Is it possible to handle attachments using Custom Entities in the first place ?
I found nothing on blogs/internet. All examples i found are based on DDIC-CDS based entities, not Custom Entities.
Thanks a lot for your help üôÇ 
Note: I tried using type abap.rawstring(0) for field AttachmentContent but it's not working either

entry.title: Re: Deleting an Unused Chart of Accounts in SAP S/4HANA ‚Äì...
entry.content:

entry.title: Re: Good Recipient cannot generated in mvt 311 when using...
entry.content:
Why the Goods Recipient field Is empty in MIGO 311 with WM Sloc could be due to the following:-

  • When you post a 311 transfer posting between storage locations that are Warehouse Management (WM)-enabled, SAP triggers WM-specific processes (e.g., transfer requirements and transfer orders). These processes do not use the Goods Recipient field from MIGO;  instead, they rely on WM logic for tracking and accountability. In WM-managed locations, the recipient is typically not relevant at the IM level because the goods are tracked by bin and transfer order.
  • Once MIGO posts the 311 movement, SAP creates a Transfer Requirement (TR) and expects the warehouse team to process it via LT06 or LT12. These transactions do not carry forward the Goods Recipient field from MIGO.

If the Goods Recipient field is critical for your process (e.g., for audit or tracking), couple of workarounds are there

  • Consider using non-WM-managed storage locations for 311 postings; this allows full control over IM-level fields.
  • If WM must be used add a custom field or enhancement to capture the Goods Recipient in the Transfer Order (TO). Use user exits or BAdIs (e.g., MWMTO001) to pass the value from MIGO to TO.

entry.title: Re: Source of data for Settlement Doc Pricing
entry.content:
You have raised two questions

  1. Does Split Criteria Control Field Population in Settlement Items?
  2. Do You Need to Append WBRP or Can Pricing Read from Business Volume or CDS?

To answer your first question, Yes, partially. The split criteria in the condition contract settlement process determines which fields from the business volume base are transferred to the settlement item (WBRP). If a field (e.g. Customer Price Group) is part of the split criteria, it will be copied into the settlement item. If it‚Äôs not part of the split criteria, it won‚Äôt be available in WBRP; and therefore, not usable in pricing unless you enhance the structure. So yes, split criteria is the key control for populating fields in settlement items.
To answer your second question, Standard pricing reads from the settlement item (WBRP); not directly from the business volume table or CDS views. So if your pricing condition (e.g. RCS1 or RCA1) uses fields like Customer Price Group or Material Price Group, those fields must be present in WBRP. Otherwise, the access sequence won‚Äôt find the condition record.

What you can do is to append WBRP with the required fields (e.g. KUNNR, MATKL, PRGRP). Include those fields in split criteria so they are populated from business volume. Enhance the business volume CDS view if you need to extract additional fields during volume determination

entry.title: Complex Multi-Rater Performance Rating Overall Calculations in SAP SuccessFactors Integration Center
entry.content:
This blog outlines a solution for calculating complex performance ratings involving multiple rater roles within SAP SuccessFactors PMGM. The methodology leverages a combination of Table Reports, SFTP, Metadata Framework (MDF), and Integration Center, demonstrating the advanced capabilities of the platform‚Äôs native tools without requiring custom development. I hope that it could inspire you about the power of combining these tools.

Background

Take below calculation logic as an example:

The standard performance rating calculation logic in SuccessFactors is insufficient when faced with certain complex requirements. The primary challenges addressed by this solution include:

  • Multiple Rater Influence: The overall rating calculation must incorporate input from various rater roles (e.g., Manager, HR, Matrix Manager), with specific weighting for each role being sourced directly from Employee Central.
  • Dynamic Goal/Competency Content: The performance form contains a variable number of goals and competencies, which are organized into multiple distinct categories.
  • Role-Specific Ratings: The final report must reference section-level ratings for each distinct rater role. And the role amount vary in different form.
  • Lack of Identifiers: Standard reporting tools and APIs do not provide a direct identifier for the specific role of the user who entered a rating, making it difficult to differentiate between inputs.

Implementation Details

The solution is implemented in three main stages: data export, data ingestion, and calculation.

Step 1: Exporting Raw Rating Data

The first step is to extract the raw rating data from the performance forms.

  1. Report Creation: Two separate Table Reports are created‚Äîone for goal ratings and one for competency ratings. Both reports are configured with an identical data structure to ensure consistency. The key fields include:
    • Subject User ID
    • Form Template ID
    • Document ID
    • Competency/Goal ID
    • Competency/Goal Other Rating (the rating value)
    • Competency/Goal Weight
    • Competency/Goal Other Rating Owner User ID (the rater's ID)
    • Form Start Date
    • Section ID
    • Section Name
  2. Data Filtering: Filters are applied to the reports to exclude irrelevant data, such as deleted forms, unrated items, and non-essential form sections.
  3. Scheduled Export: A daily scheduled job is configured to export the reports as CSV files to a designated SFTP server. It is important to note that Table Reports are essential for this step; the Integration Center cannot be used directly to export all ratings from a performance form as it requires a specific Form Data ID to be provided as a parameter.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Step 2: Ingesting Data via Integration Center

Next, the exported data is consumed and processed.

  1. File Consumption: The SFTP server will contain daily goal and competency files, each appended with a date suffix.
  2. Integration Setup: Two separate Integration Center jobs are configured to process these files. Each job maps the fields from its respective CSV file to a custom MDF object.

Note: The integration must be configured to use the Upsert Single operation. This is mandatory because the process updates a parent-child MDF object structure, and this operation ensures data integrity for both the parent and child records within a single execution.

Step 3: Executing Calculations via MDF Business Rules

The core logic of the solution resides in business rules attached to the custom MDF object. When the Integration Center upserts data into the MDF object, onSave rules are automatically triggered to perform the calculations.

The MDF object is structured with parent and child levels to properly organize the data for calculation. The key fields and logic are detailed below:

MDF Object Field Description

ParentexternalCodeMaps to Subject User ID.
ParentexternalNameMaps to Document ID.
ParenteffectiveStartDateMaps to Form Start Date.
ParentOverallRating, etc.Stores the final calculated ratings for each role and the overall score.
ChildexternalCodeA composite key created from ItemID + RaterUserID.
ChildRoleThe calculated rater role (e.g., EM, EX) based on Job Relationships.
ChildCategoryMaps to the Section Name from the performance form.
ChilditemRatingThe weighted item rating, calculated as Rating * Weight.

Key Business Rule Logic

Several critical business rules drive the automated calculations:

  • Role Type Identification: This rule determines the rater's role by cross-referencing the Rating User ID from the form with the employee's Job Relationship data in Employee Central. A condition is included to prevent the role from being cleared if a rater's job relationship has changed since the form was completed.

  • Role-Specific Section Rating: The solution calculates the section-level rating for each rater role (e.g., Goal Section Rating for the Manager, Competency Section Rating for HR). This is achieved using the Sum of Collection Field Values() function, which aggregates the itemRating values from the child object, filtered by the rater's Role and Category.

  • Overall Rating Calculation: The final, overall rating is computed by applying the appropriate weighting for each rater's section scores. Since these weight proportions are sourced from Employee Central, the business rule includes conditional logic to apply different calculation formulas based on the configuration stored in EC for the subject employee.

Conclusion and Further Applications

This solution successfully automates a complex, multi-rater performance rating calculation by integrating several standard SAP SuccessFactors tools. The final calculated data, stored within the custom MDF object, becomes readily available for analysis and reporting through Canvas and Story reports.

Furthermore, because the performance form's unique Document ID is stored in the MDF object, a subsequent integration can be configured. We could import the calculated overall rating back into the corresponding field on the in-progress performance management form, fully closing the loop on the process and ensuring data consistency across the system.

entry.title: Re: ARM Process Issue
entry.content:
This behavior is likely due to how SAP ARM determines follow-up activities based on material master settings, Return reason, Inspection outcome and customizing in LO-ARM (Advanced Returns Management).
SAP may attempt to create SD2 if it interprets the scenario as a free replacement delivery, even if the refund type is set to Replacement. This can happen if the replacement material is not properly maintained or determined, the inspection result or return reason maps to a follow-up activity that includes SD2 and there‚Äôs a fallback logic in ARM that defaults to SD2 when replacement fails.

  • Review your ARM Customizing Sales and Distribution > Advanced Returns Management > Define Follow-Up Activities. Here, check the mapping of return reasons and inspection codes to follow-up activities. Ensure that replacement is correctly assigned and SD2 is not inadvertently triggered.
  • Ensure the replacement material is correctly maintained in the return order. If the material is missing or invalid, SAP may default to SD2 or fail silently.
  • Even if SLG1 is empty, try SM13 for update failures and ST22 for dumps

You can try reading the cost centres from second table and pass it to first table. Something like below should work but adjust it as per your table and dimension names.

var sel =Table_2.getSelections();
	if (sel.length > 0) {
		var CCmemberId = ArrayUtils.create(Type.string);	
	for(var i=0;i<=sel.length;i++)
		{
	for (var dimensionId in sel[i]) {

			if(CCmemberId.indexOf(currentCC) === -1 && currentCC)
			{
			   CCmemberId.push(currentCC);
			
			}}
				
	}}}
	
//Applying the filter to Table 1	
	Table_1.getDataSource().setDimensionFilter("COST_CENTER",CCmemberId);

Hope this helps !!

entry.title: Re: Split FU (item or header level) using web service
entry.content:
Hi @Wolfgang_Mayer1 

Thanks for clarifying your scenario.

Based on the standard SAP S/4HANA 2023 TM, there's no delivered web service to split an existing Freight Unit.

Based on the data available the only way to fully automate FU splitting is through custom development, typically by:

  • Creating a custom OData/SOAP endpoint or enhancement BADI.
  • Leveraging the BOPF service manager to invoke a split action on the /SCMTMS/FU business object (either at item or header level).

This approach re-produces the ‚ÄúChange Freight Unit‚Äù UI behaviour programmatically.

I hope this helps provide the information required. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris
